buildup.text: Britain bombarded German lines for a week before the attack on July 1, 1916. Commanders expected an easy advance.

discovery.text: German soldiers survived in deep dugouts. When the bombardment stopped, they emerged and mowed down British infantry.

twist.text: The battle raged for 141 days. Britain gained about 6 miles of territory at a cost of over one million casualties.

climax.text: Tanks appeared for the first time at the Sommeâ€”crude, slow, but a glimpse of how future wars would be fought.

punchline.text: Six miles, one million casualties, 141 days of hell.
